intro: Geum quellyon, commonly known as Canadian goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Geum quellyon plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies due to its abundant nectar-rich flowers.
